page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY OF SOUTHREPPS
page.content:
ORIGIN - Southrepps probably originated in the ninth century as "Repples" or cultivated land between the wastes of heath, marsh and woodland. The village was part of "SOKE OF GIMINGHAM", a federation of villages; later royal estate.
SETTLEMENT - Within the parish are two distinct parts - UPPER STREET and APPLEYARD STREET or LOWER STREET. The latter grew up in the medieval era as an expanding population took up new land and built homes on the far edge of the manor.
HISTORIC BUILDINGS - For centuries in both parts of Southrepps people have extended, altered and rebuilt their houses and shops. Many buildings show signs of having been used for 20 generations.
